result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Yeargain Park was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Phillip Yeargain Park is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Phillip Yeargain Park was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Phillip Yeargain Park was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Phillip Yeargain Park was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Concurrent to Counts 3, 4 and 16CF2.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow through with mental health treatment and take all prescribed medications.
-Participate in MRT.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to de-brief at the St. Croix County Sheriff.
-Maintain a residence with parents.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Phillip Yeargain Park appeared. Case called at 2:26. Includes 15CF583, 16CF249, 14CF329, 15CF210, 16CF55, 16CF02. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1, 3, 4 in 16CF55 and G to Ct 1 in 16CF02. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 3, 4 in 16CF55 and guilty of Ct 1 in 16CF02. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CF55 and 15CF583, 16CF249, 14CF329, 15CF210. Sentencing arguments. DE father makes a statement. DE makes statement. Crt orders: 
In 16CF55 Sentence I/S
Ct. 1
3 years 6 months, 1 year 6 months initial confinement, 2 years 0 months extended supervision with the following conditions:
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Costs of $4000 for all for counts. This includes 16CF55 Ct. 1, 3, 4 and 16CF02. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge,
- Follow through with mental health treatment and take all prescribed medications. 
- Participate in MRT.
- Random and regular testing.
- DE to de-brief at the SCSO.
- Maintain a residence with parents. 

Ct. 3
-9 months St. Croix County Jail
Same conditions as Ct. 1

Ct. 4
3 years 6 months, 1 year 6 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision
Same conditions as Ct. 1 and 3. 


In 16CF02 Sentence  I/S
5 years 0 months, 2 years 0 months initial confinement, 3 years 0 month extended supervision.
Same conditions as 16CF55.


150 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
Def to report to probation by 4pm on 1/23/17
Filed by Atty Repka. Requesting a continuance of Plea on 1/17/2017. Hearing reset. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Phillip Yeargain Park appeared. Case called at 4:52. Includes 14CF329, 15CF210, 15CF583, 16CF02, 16CF55, 16CF249. Court reviews all files. ADA Minser moves to reopen 14CF329 and 15CF210 and counts that were originally a part of the resolution. Atty. Repka responds. Court reopens 14CF329 and 15CF210 and Ct's 2,3,5 in 15CF583 are re-opened along with Ct 1,2,4 in 16CF55. Atty's to meet with the JA to schedule a JT with the oldest file to be tried first. FPT is to be scheduled 3 weeks prior to the JT.

**AMENDED**
Includes 16CF55, 16CF02, 15CF583, 16CF249.

  __ SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $4000.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S: Phillip A. Park

- This Bond is Contingent upon the Washington County warrant being quashed.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

- Report every Mon, Wed. and Sat. before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Phillip Yeargain Park appeared. Case called at 8:40. Includes 16CF55,16CF02, 15CF583, 16CF249. Set for a bond review today. Atty. Repka argues bond. Washington County is a payable Warrant. ADA Minser responds. Court amends bond contigent upon the Washington County Warrant being quashed.

CO: Needham, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Phillip Yeargain Park appeared from jail. Includes SEH 15CF583, 16CF2 and 16CF55 and ARGN on 16CF249. Case called at 3:56 pm. Atty Repka makes updates the court. Defendant wishes to withdraw his plea. Court will continue hearing and set for Motion to withdraw plea. ADA Minser makes statement. The state does not object to withdraw to plea. Court approves withdrawl of pleas. On 16CF249,   Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. NG. Discovery to be provided. Waive Speedy to all files. Bond continues in form and amount. Atty Repka requests to have bond reinstated. ADA Minser responds. Court will have Defendant to remain here.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 04:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Phillip Yeargain Park appeared. Case called at 8:11. Includes 14CF329, 15CF210, 5CF583, 16CF02, 16CF55. Atty. Repka recites agreement. ADA Minser agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1, 4  in 15CF583. DE pleads NC to Ct 3 in 16CF55. DE pleads NC to 16CF02. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and 4 in 15CF583, guilty of Ct 3 in 16CF55 and guilty of 16CF02. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3 and 5 in 15CF583, Ct. 1, 2 and 4 in 16CF55, 14CF329 and 15CFR210. Court orders a PSI. State is seeking a remand. ADA Minser will not be filing any further bail jumping charges. Court revokes bond and remands DE. All cash on file will be kept on file for costs. PSI to be completed by 07-01-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
